They err as to the very nature of Christian mortifi- cation : for they consider the afflicting and injuring of the body to be true mortification 3 whereas, that pertains chiefly not to the flesh, or the inferior part of the soul, but chiefly to the mind and will: for the mind and will of a man not yet renewed are carnal.
